III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The facility had five special investigations during the period under review. Out of the
five investigations, four resulted in full compliance with one resulting in a corrective
action plan. The facility is currently in full compliance with the corrective action plan.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The assessment discussed the prior citations for the interim inspection, including
violations for admission health screening, periodic physical exams, and reporting
restraints in MiSACWIS. The report reviews the current corrective action plan that
was implemented which is showing significant progress. The report does not identify
any current non-compliance.
Interviews:
Staff and Youth were interviewed at the facility on December 14, 2021. Staff all
reported that they feel very supported by the supervisors and administration. Two of
the three staff reported they feel the training is appropriate and adequate. One of the
staff said it would be helpful for new staff to have more “shadow shifts”. Staff did not
have any ongoing concerns that were not being met. Youth all reported they feel safe
at the facility and enjoy the programming. Youth did not have any concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
4

Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
